entry.title: Re: Usage Records (GET on /usage-records)
entry.content:
Hello Danashree,
The itemId and chargeId are unique identifiers for the bill item and the charge within the bill model. 
These properties can only be retrieved from GET on /bills/{identifier} if expand parameter usageRecords is applied and the number of returned usage records is more than 100.

Please check information provide within the API Guide here Retrieve Usage Records for a Charge

Kind regards 
Ralf

entry.title: Re: Can we copy unreleased CDS view code and use it for d...
entry.content:
Hi ,

Yes, you can make your own custom views by copying the unpublished CDS view code, but do not rely on it as a stable dependence.

  • Unreleased views are not stable.

    • SAP may change or delete them without notice in upgrades.

    • You risk breaking your custom view if you depend too tightly on them.

  • SAP does not support reuse of unreleased views.

    • If you raise an OSS incident, SAP will not support issues related to unreleased CDS usage.

  • Performance and Authorization Issues:

    • Unreleased CDS views may not be optimized or may lack correct annotations like @AccessControl.authorizationCheck.

Hope it helps!

Thanks with regards,

Raaj

entry.title: Message dteermination for PO: Exclusive indicator not working
entry.content:
Dear gurus,

 

I fear that for years I might have had a big misconception about messages for POs and in general and I would appreciate if you could clarify.

 

In our system it was our idea to create two message types for POs: ZMAI for E-Mail and ZPRI for print output. Thus, we thought it would be easier for our users if they ever had to manually create a message.

 

We set up our message determination schema like this:

10           1             ZPRI       PO print               101

11           1             ZMAI     PO e-mail            101

 

Furthermore, we created one condition record for ZMAI for document type NB. For the few suppliers who want to recieve the POs printed on paper, we created an additional condition type for ZPRI for Doc.Type/Purch.Org/Vendor.

 

We expected SAP to automatically create a ZPRI message if there was a vendor-specific condition record (Doc.Type/Purch.Org/Vendor) for ZPRI and a ZMAI message if not.

 

Instead, if there is a vendor-specific ZPRI condition record, BOTH messages are created.

 

I did not understand this, because the access sequence is set up like this:

5             027         Purchasing Output Determination: Purch. Org./Vendor for EDI                  exclusive

11           025         Purchasing Output Determination: Doc.Type/Purch.Org/Vendor              exclusive

20           026         Purchasing Output Determination: Document Type                                        exclusive

 

Because auf the exclusive indicator I expected SAP to stop looking for the second condition record (document type NB). But it does not, it finds both records.

 

Now I fear that that is because we created two seperate message types and the access sequence is valid for both of them independently. Thus, first the ZPRI record is found and then SAP finds the ZMAI record.

 

Could anyone please check and confirm? Thank you!

 

Furthermore I would like to know if the only way to achieve the desired behaviour is to create just ONE message type with two processing routines, one for print output and one for external send.

 

Cheers
Jens

entry.title: Re: Adaptation projects in Business Application Studio br...
entry.content:
I was having similar issues after the updates that you have mentioned. ( I wasn't able to preview the app at all and adaptation editor wasn't starting). What I did is to change the the ui5 version in ui5.yaml file which helped out with that issue and everything started working again.

Afterwards however I got a new issue, each time when I made some changes to the app, the changes didn't show up in the local version and was impossible to debug (the only way was to deploy to production system and debug and test there). Today I managed to find a solution for that as well. What I did was:

- delete the node_moddules folder from the app
- ran the "npm install" command. (but got a lot of vulnerabilities, some were critical)
- ran "npm audit fix" which fixed most of the vulnerabilities, but not all (the critical ones were resolved)

Now the last changes that I make to the app, show up in the local version and I'm able to debug again.
Hope this helps!

entry.title: How to separate supplier production lead time and transit time in MRP (info record level?)
entry.content:
Hola, 

En nuestra empresa, compramos materiales tanto a proveedores nacionales como a proveedores asi√°ticos, donde los productos son de nuestra propiedad ya en el pa√≠s de origen.
Necesitamos diferenciar entre dos componentes temporales:

  • El plazo de producci√≥n del proveedor, y

  • El tiempo de tr√°nsito (es decir, el tiempo que tarda el material en llegar a Espa√±a por mar u otros medios).

Hasta ahora, s√≥lo hemos encontrado el campo "Tiempo de entrega planificado (tiempo de procesamiento EM)" en la vista MRP 2 del maestro de materiales, que funciona de la siguiente manera:

  • En la solicitud de pedido, el sistema respeta la fecha de entrega del proveedor.

  • En MD04, agrega el tiempo de procesamiento EM, por lo que podemos ver la fecha prevista de llegada a Espa√±a (producci√≥n + tr√°nsito).

El problema es que este campo se mantiene a nivel de material, y podemos tener el mismo material comprado tanto a un proveedor nacional como internacional.

En este caso, SAP aplica el mismo tiempo de tr√°nsito a ambos, lo cual es incorrecto. Necesitamos una soluci√≥n m√°s flexible, idealmente algo que se mantenga a nivel de registro de informaci√≥n o de proveedor, de modo que el tiempo de tr√°nsito se aplique solo cuando sea apropiado.

entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

We are set price list to all vendors and mapped that price to vendors in CRM.  Now Purchase order get item price automatically form that list. I want user do not change price if he change then its go for approval. 

 

i right the query but its go for approval every time even price not change. Can you please check query & corrected it. 

SELECT DISTINCT 'True'
FROM OPOR T0
INNER JOIN POR1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry"
INNER JOIN OCRD T2 ON T0."CardCode" = T2."CardCode"
INNER JOIN ITM1 T3 ON T1."ItemCode" = T3."ItemCode"
AND T3."PriceList" = T2."ListNum"
WHERE T1."Price" <> T3."Price"

Regards, 

GK

entry.title: Re: Add a custom field in manage teams and responsibiliti...
entry.content:
Hi,

It's likely that you did not correctly release the CDS view, or the custom fields are not correctly named, or maintained. 

Here are the steps you can follow:

  1. Create a Custom Field: Ensure that your custom field is created using the ‚ÄòCustom Fields‚Äô app in SAP Fiori. Make sure the field type is ‚ÄòCode List‚Äô and it is published.

  2. Define Custom Responsibility Definition:

    • Log on to SAP Fiori launchpad as a business process configuration expert.
    • Navigate to ‚ÄòManage Your Solution‚Äô and select ‚ÄòConfigure Your Solution‚Äô.
    • Choose ‚ÄòResponsibility Management‚Äô from the Application Area list.
    • Select ‚ÄòResponsibility Definition‚Äô and configure a new custom responsibility definition.
    • Ensure the CDS view and field name are correctly selected and the responsibility definition name starts with ‚ÄòZ_‚Äô.

  3. Assign Custom Responsibility Definition to CDS View:

    • Ensure you are using a released CDS view or a custom field enabled in the UIs and Reports tab.
    • Follow the procedure to assign the custom responsibility definition to the CDS view.

Best regards, Dequan Xu

entry.title: Context matters: Use AI to improve customer experience and the processes behind
entry.content:
Enhancing customer experience is crucial for business success. By leveraging AI for context analysis you can now interpret vast amounts of unstructured process-related data, such as experience data and link it to the underlying process steps - to improve both customer experience and operational efficiency.

Customer experience is not just a buzzword‚Äîit has risen to become a critical differentiator for businesses. It's not just about offering a quality product or service; it's about how you make your customers feel throughout their journey and how they experience your brand and your processes.  

To truly comprehend and enhance customer experience, companies need to take a holistic approach and link these experiences (and customer sentiment) to the underlying business processes that drive them.  

This requires processing and analyzing large volumes of structured and unstructured data, which is obviously a daunting task.  Fortunately, the revolutionary capabilities of artificial intelligence make this feasible - and simple - for the first time. 

Breaching the new frontiers of customer experience with AI

You're likely familiar with how SAP Signavio helps organizations map, analyze, and optimize processes and customer journeys to enhance customer experience. Now, by leveraging AI, we're extending our support even further, providing the foundation for more contextual decisions that drive both customer experience and process improvements. 

Unlike experience-led systems that typically try to improve sentiment but neglect the process view, or traditional process-led solutions that help achieve process optimization but neglect the customer experience perspective, SAP Signavio solutions bridge the gap, resulting in processes that accomplish their original purpose: serving customers effectively. 

Introducing the new AI-assisted context analyzer 

The new AI-assisted context analyzer capability, now available as part of a dedicated beta program, leverages artificial intelligence to interpret huge amounts of unstructured customer data, including reviews, surveys, comments, and complaints. It then derives potential connections between that feedback, both positive and negative, and steps in a company‚Äôs business process. 

The context analyzer helps you to: 

  • automatically label comments with sentiments (neutral, positive and negative) 
  • map this experience data to relevant process events 
  • present this experience data within interactive process dashboards for intuitive interpretation 

By leveraging this capability, both internal roles within your company (e.g process owners, business analysts, C-levels), as well as customer facing roles can explore key process stages, identify experience bottlenecks, and understand exactly what caused customers to feel the way they do.

This isn't just about analyzing text but connecting real customer feedback with the processes behind it and rapidly acting on those insights.

You can obtain the context you need to optimize processes while generating the best experiences possible for your customers. This enables you to not only streamline operations but also prioritize improvements that deliver the most value to the customer experience.

Then,  you can continue to monitor customer feedback so to ensure this experience is maintained and improved upon.  

Holistic view of end-to-end processes 

Beyond enhancing customer experience, the AI-assisted context analyzer can also connect process execution data to other contextual sources, such as support tickets, chat logs, emails, ERP/CRM notes, audit logs, and manual annotations. This provides companies with a comprehensive, bird‚Äôs-eye view of their end-to-end processes. 

Start leveraging AI to drive customer experience forward today 

Our context analyzer is currently in beta and being tested by selected SAP Signavio customers and you can be part of it too. 

Seats are limited, so act fast! Contact your customer success partner or account manager to apply or write us here.  An active SAP Signavio Process Intelligence license is required.

entry.title: Re: Manage Tax items for Legal Reporting on Tax Reporting...
entry.content:
Hi all,

 

Please note that the message 'Results are displayed based on your authorization and filter selection' is an informational message only. It does not affect the inclusion or exclusion of documents in the Manage Tax Items activity.

Also, for VAT reporting, the system does not rely on the document date or posting date. Instead, it uses the Tax Reporting Date (also known as the VAT Date) to determine which documents are relevant for a given reporting period.

 

Kindly refer the below help document for more information on Manage Tax Items activity,

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/4de200b26d5d42bbacae69c6bf6b9923/0a50b7fec5594e738568b1808f02625e.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION

 

Best regards,

Atanu

entry.title: Re: When I called BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE, "Update was canceled" received from author &quo
entry.content: The error message in transaction SM13 directed me to check transaction ST22, and the corresponding ST22 dump is as follows.

entry.title: Re: When I called BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE, "Update was canceled" received from author &quo
entry.content: An exception has occurred in class "CX_SY_OPEN_SQL_DB". This exception wa caught in procedure "SD_PARTNER_UPDATE" "(FUNCTION)" or propagated by a RAISING clause. Since the caller of the procedure could not have anticipated this exception, the current program was terminated. The reason for the exception occurring was: The reason for the exception is: When an Open SQL array insert is performed, trying to insert a record into the database table "VBPA" causes the function to terminate if a record with the same key already exists. (When an Open SQL individual record insert is performed, this situation does not cause the function to terminate. SY-SUBRC is set to 4 instead.)

entry.title: Re: When I called BAPI_SALESORDER_CHANGE, "Update was canceled" received from author &quo
entry.content: How should I modify the code based on the following message? If the exception cannot be prevented, "CX_SY_OPEN_SQL_DB" must be caught withi procedure "SD_PARTNER_UPDATE" "(FUNCTION)" or declared in the procedure's RAISING clause. To prevent the exception, note the following: Open SQL array insert should only be used if it is certain that none of the records specified already exists on the database. If this cannot be guaranteed, exception CX_SY_OPEN_SQL_DB should be intercepted, and the error must be resolved. If the error occurs in a non-modfied SAP program, you might be able to find a solution in the SAP Notes system. If you have access to the SAP Notes system, check there first using the following keywords: "DBSQL_DUPLICATE_KEY_ERROR" CX_SY_OPEN_SQL_DB "SAPLV05I" bzw. LV05IU15 "SD_PARTNER_UPDATE" If you cannot solve the problem yourself, please send the following information to SAP: 1. The description of the problem (short dump) Please press the "Local File‚Äù button in the current display. 2. The relevant system log To do this, call the system log in transaction SM21. Restrict the time interval to ten minutes before the short dump and five minutes after it. In the display, choose System -> List -> Save -> Local File (unconverted). 3. If these are programs of your own, or modified SAP programs: The source text of the programs To do this, please choose "Other Utilities -> Upload/Download -> Download". 4. Details regarding the conditions under which the error occurred or which actions and input caused the error. which actions and input caused the error.

entry.title: Issues with SAP Business Hub REST API consumption in CAP App
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a scenario, where I need to fetch all data from OMF Product API which is available in SAP Business Acclerator Hub as a REST service.

Overview | Products | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

When I import the JSON/YAML service as directed in all CAP guides, it is imported. But there is no entity definition.

My objective is to fetch all the records with $top and $skip and show it in a simple CAP List View app without storing it in persistence storage (Like HANA Cloud). 

Can you provide a guide or help on how I can achieve it? I have done it through the REST Proxy method but it is failing to get a large set of data and getting timeout.

DB Schema

entity Product {
  key id                          : UUID;
      displayId                   : String;
      externalSystemReferences    : String;
      name                        : String;
      productType                 : String;
      description                 : String;
      published                   : Boolean;
      replicationType             : String;
      soldElectronically          : Boolean;
      markedForDeletion           : Boolean;
      activeMarketIds             : String;
      aspectId                    : String;
      baseUnitOfMeasure           : String;
      physicalProductCategory     : String;
      physicalProductGroup        : String;
      physicalProductItemCategory : String;
      physicalProductType         : String;
      salesAreaData               : String;
      unitOfMeasures              : String;
}

 SERVICE.JS

const { default: cds } = require("@sap/cds");

module.exports = cds.service.impl(async function () {
    const {
        Product
    } = this.entities;
    var firstRead = true;
    this.before('READ', Product, async (req) => {
        try {
            if (firstRead) {
                var recfound = 0;
                var pageNumber = 0; 
                var pageSize = req.query.SELECT.limit.rows.val;
                do {
                    const sapOmf = await cds.connect.to('sapOmfProductApi');
                    const resp = await sapOmf.get('/product-management/v1/products?pageNumber=' + pageNumber); // + "&pageSize=" + pageSize);
                    const products = resp;
                    const entries = [];
                    //products.forEach(product => {
                    for (const product of products) {
                        const extSystem = product.externalSystemReferences;
                        let extSysText = '';
                        if (extSystem) {
                            extSystem.forEach(es => {
                                extSysText += es.externalId + '-' + es.externalSystemId + ",";
                            });
                        }

                        const prodDetail = await sapOmf.get('/product-management/v1/products/' + product.id);
                        const amkid = prodDetail.activeMarketIds;
                        const salesArea = prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.salesAreaData;
                        const uom = prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.unitOfMeasures;
                        let mktext = '';
                        if (amkid) {
                            amkid.forEach(mk => {
                                mktext += mk + '-';
                            });
                        }
                        let satext = '';
                        if (salesArea) {
                            salesArea.forEach(area => {
                                satext += 'Active:' + area.active + '-' + 'Distribution Channel:' + area.distributionChannel + '-' +
                                    'Division:' + area.division + '-' + 'Pricing Ref Product:' + area.pricingReferenceProduct + '-' +
                                    'Product Pricing Group:' + area.productPricingGroup + '-' + 'Sales Org:' + area.salesOrganization + ',';
                            });
                        }

                        let uomtext = '';
                        if (uom) {
                            uom.forEach(um => {
                                uomtext += um.alternativeUnitOfMeasure + '-' + um.numerator + '-' + um.denominator + ',';
                            });
                        }
                        entries.push({
                            id: product.id,
                            displayId: product.displayId,
                            externalSystemReferences: extSysText,
                            name: product.name,
                            productType: product.productType,
                            description: product.description,
                            published: product.published,
                            replicationType: product.replicationType,
                            soldElectronically: product.soldElectronically,
                            markedForDeletion: product.markedForDeletion,
                            activeMarketIds: mktext,
                            salesAreaData: satext,
                            unitOfMeasures: uomtext,
                            aspectId: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.aspectId,
                            baseUnitOfMeasure: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.baseUnitOfMeasure,
                            physicalProductType: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductType,
                            physicalProductItemCategory: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductItemCategory,
                            physicalProductCategory: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductCategory,
                            physicalProductGroup: prodDetail.aspectsData.physicalProduct.physicalProductGroup
                        });
                    }
                    // delete all countries

                    await cds.tx(req).run(INSERT.into(Product).entries(entries));
                    firstRead = false;
                    pageNumber++;
                    recfound = entries.length;

                } while (recfound > 0);
                return req;
            }
        } catch (err) {
            req.error(500, err.message);
        }
    });
});

This is using a schema and trying to insert data in that DB table every time. I am sure this not the best method and for large set of data it is not working. Please let me know the best way and how I can fetch data in bunch like 30 records at a time.

entry.title: Re: Understanding Relationship Types in SAP CAP: One-to-One, One-to-Many, and Many-to-Many
entry.content:
@Saone yes, you can actually do that

The difference here is that what you applied is known as managed associations. This means the CDS generates the foreign key and the on clause through the existing primary key.

The example provided was using an unmanaged association. Unmanaged associations explicitly specify arbitrary join conditions in their on clause, which refer to available foreign key fields.

For the sake of conciseness and comprehensibility, it is recommended to use managed associations for to-one associations.

entry.title: Re: BoE ‚Äì AP: Why Can‚Äôt We Set Maturity Date per Supplier...
entry.content:
Hi Divyesh, 

Thank you for your reply.

Yes, based on my previous testing, the BoE maturity date in the system is currently determined by the payment terms. May I confirm if this is standard system behavior and best practice?

Also, thank you for suggesting the approach of creating vendor-specific payment terms and assigning them in the supplier master. However, there is only one field available in the supplier master for maintaining payment terms, and we are currently using that to define the payment terms for supplier invoices, not for BoE.

If we assign a specific payment term in the supplier master, does that mean it will be applied to both the supplier invoice and the BoE maturity date? In our case, the payment terms for supplier invoices and BoE ‚Äì AP are different. 

For example:

  • Supplier Master: ABC | Payment Terms: Payable immediately, Due net, Baseline date at end of the month

  • If supplier invoice created for Supplier ABC,  then this will be due at the end of the month.

  • Before the invoice due date, the user would execute an automatic payment run and pay the invoice via BoE.

  • At that point, the BoE maturity date should ideally be determined automatically based on the contract term set per supplier (e.g. 60 days).

  • So, if I run the payment on 28 July 2025, the BoE maturity date should automatically be 26 September 2025 based on a 60-day maturity term.

Appreciate it if you could check the explanation above and share your feedbac

Thanks in advance!

Best regards, 

HY

entry.title: Re: Message dteermination for PO: Exclusive indicator not...
entry.content:
Yes you are right. The exclusive indicator in the access sequence applies within a single message type, not across multiple message types. So yes, because you‚Äôve defined ZMAI and ZPRI as separate message types, SAP evaluates the access sequence independently for each one, even if they share the same schema.

For ZPRI, SAP finds the vendor-specific condition record via the Doc.Type/Purch.Org/Vendor combination and stops there because of the exclusive flag. Then, for ZMAI, it runs the same access sequence independently and finds the general condition record for Doc.Type NB‚Äîeven though ZPRI already succeeded. The system doesn‚Äôt cross-check between message types. Each message type runs its own determination logic, and if both find valid condition records, both get triggered.

In order to overcome from this issue, have a single message type (e.g., ZPO) and differentiate output medium (email vs. print) via processing routines or partner functions. Alternatively, add a requirement routine to ZMAI that checks if ZPRI was already determined and suppresses ZMAI. Consider using output control via BRF+ (if you're on S/4HANA) for more flexible logic.

entry.title: Re: Changing LGORT for WM Staging (CO02/LB10)
entry.content: Look into Function Module LTAP_CREATE_TR or LTA_CREATE_TR, which is involved in TO creation. Use implicit enhancement at the beginning of the routine where LGORT is set. entry.title: SAP IBP Inventory - EOQ Key Figures questions
entry.content:
Hi all,

I'm building an EOQ scenario calculation and trying to get a understanding of the KF's used in EOQ and Service Level Calculation. 

Unfortunately, the IBP Help page does not clearly explain the context or logic behind how these input key figures should be populated. I would really appreciate any guidance or feedback from those who have implemented or tested a similar setup.

The scenario is simple: an external supplier delivers goods to only one DC, which is also customer facing. Transport and customer ratios are 1. The Demand Forecast is 100,000 pcs per week. Supplier lead + transport time is 4 weeks with no frozen horizon maintained. I have activated time-varying costs per all three input KF's. 

KF1: Demand Rate Per Period
Should this be populated with the weekly product forecast (i.e., 100,000 pcs), or should it represent the 4-week forecast corresponding to the supplier lead+ transport time (400,000 pcs)?
The standard EOQ formula assumes an annual demand, but IBP Inventory Optimization works with a weekly planning period by default..

KF2: Holding Cost Rate Per Period
Does this refer to the warehousing/inventory carrying costs?
For example, if I expect to hold 100,000 pcs in a period, should this key figure reflect the total cost of storing those units for one week?

KF3: Transportation Fixed Cost Per Order
Should this include both transportation and goods receipt (GR) handling costs?
Also, how should we handle volume-based differentiation‚Äîe.g., receiving three containers costs more than one, but EOQ assumes a fixed cost per order. 

Thanks in advance for your support!

entry.title: Administration of SAP PAPM Cloud using BYOD Standalone SAP HANA Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

In my previous blog post, SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Subscription with BYOD plan, I have shared to you how to subscribe with the newly release plan of SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud(SAP PAPM Cloud) which is the Bring Your Own Database(BYOD) plan.

With this new plan, you can maximize the SAP PAPM Cloud solution to perform high-volume data calculations and processing with more efficiency from your existing Standalone SAP HANA Cloud Database(Standalone HCDB) and SAP Datasphere.

What do we mean by efficiency? Imagine, your high-volume data is already sitting on your existing Standalone HCDB or SAP Datasphere where your SAP PAPM Cloud is mapped or connected. Therefore, creation of connections like Remote Source is not needed as you only need to perform the proper granting of privileges to technical schemas of your SAP PAPM Cloud.

Sounds cool right? Before we proceed on how you can perform integration such as the scenario above, it is important for you to know first that the Default and BYOD plan are still functionally the same. Absolutely no difference and still uses one code line.

The only difference is just the plan itself.

Alright, I hope that‚Äôs clear for us. Let‚Äôs now proceed with what‚Äôs happening when we subscribed to a BYOD plan of SAP PAPM Cloud.

Note: This blog post focuses on the usage of Standalone HCDB as the database in BYOD plan of SAP PAPM Cloud. Please stay tuned for the next blog post focusing on SAP Datasphere as the database in BYOD Plan.

Important topics are divided into 3 chapters so you can focus on what is relevant for your use case.

  1. Introducing technical users in Standalone HCDB.
  2. Authorization Grants for Standard Model
  3. Authorization Grants for Universal Model

Introducing technical users in Standalone HCDB BYOD plan

Since you can use multiple SAP PAPM Cloud tenants on one Standalone HCDB it is necessary for you to know what are the available schemas you can use to perform such integration in your own database.

SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like user

Once you subscribed to  SAP PAPM Cloud that uses BYOD plan, a user will be generated in Administration > Settings that you can use to login on your Standalone HCDB.

SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TENANTID>_<UNIQUEID>_RT.

Please take note of this IDs as it will be the indicator who owns the artifact on the Database level in case you have multiple tenants connected to your Standalone HCDB.

Please take note that the Database user above does not equate to the roles granted to SAP_PAPM_ADMIN from default subscription. In BYOD, you have the freedom to grant the roles which you think are needed for your users.

If you wish to add roles like those granted for SAP_PAPM_ADMIN default plan by default, you may visit this, Database Role PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE to check the roles. 

Below is a sample step on how you can perform the granting of roles:

 a.    Create PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE example:

CREATE ROLE PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE;

b.   Using the information in Database Role PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE, perform the following SQL, example:

GRANT CATALOG READ TO PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE;

To verify you may check in the Database the Role Management section in Database.

Do this for all the succeeding grants.

c.   Once done, assign this role to the SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like user which can be found in database settings, example:

GRANT PAPM_OPERATOR_ROLE TO SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TENANTID>_<UNIQUEID>;

Technical schemas on Standalone HCDB BYOD plan

For you to have an idea with how you can understand the naming convention of schema available after BYOD subscription, refer to the screenshot and table below.

Model

Default Subscription

BYOD Subscription

Standard Model

SAP_PAPM

SAP_PAPM_SM_<TENANTID> is the schema where all artifacts from Standard Model can be found

Standard Model

SAP_PAPM_ADMIN

SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TENANTID>_<UNIQUEID>_RT is the database username in Database Settings 

Universal Model

SAP_PAPM_UM

SAP_PAPM_UM_<TENANTID> is the schema where all artifacts from Universal Model can be found

Standard Model

Following the procedures added in the help portal Connections, you may start performing Inbound and Outbound scenarios for Standard Model given by the steps below.

Inbound Scenarios

Accessing artifacts from External SAP HANA Cloud schema

Your existing schema can be used as an Authoring schema on one of the connections in SAP PAPM Cloud to be used for consumption.

Initially, if you are going to create a Connection in Connection Management screen, your schema is not yet visible to be used as expected.

This is because we need to grant a privilege to the technical schema of SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model which is the equivalent of SAP_PAPM schema.

  1. With this, you need to login on your Standalone HCDB using your external schema credentials using the syntax below:
‚ÄãCONNECT DBMEMBER PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;

      2. Once logged in, perform the SQL syntax below to perform the granting of privileges to the technical schema of your SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model.

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA "DBMEMBER" TO <SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>;

This SQL statement above is performed for your external schema to appear in the list of schema on the creation of HANA connection.

    3. After granting of privileges, you can now go back to your Connection Management Screen and your external schema will be available, then you can choose the artifact you prefer. For example, see image below:

The created connection will be eligible for usage in Modeling and from here, we can now successfully consume the table from your existing external schema.

Disclaimer: Data records used on the image above are all dummy and just to show the successful modeling after the granting of privileges.

Writing to SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model artifacts (Y-tables) from External SAP HANA Cloud schema

This scenario is not possible as artifacts from SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model are only designed for consumption and not for writing.

Outbound Scenarios

Expose SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model artifacts to external SAP HANA Cloud schema.

If you will be needing the artifacts from SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model to be read by your external SAP HANA Cloud schema, you may follow the procedure below.

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_XXXXX_YYYYY_RT as this user refers to SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like schema which is default database user available after subscription.
‚ÄãCONNECT <SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>_<UniqueID>_RT PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;

       2. Once logged in as the SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_XXXXX_YYYYY_RT user, you may now perform the below SQL Statement syntax to grant the privilege to available artifacts to external schema:

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA ‚ÄúSAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>‚Äù TO ‚Äú<ExternalUser>;‚Äã

This SQL Statement above will allow the external schema to perform a read on y-tables available in SAP PAPM Cloud SM.

SAP_PAPM_SM_<XXXX> refers to schema where the generated artifacts of Standard Model are located. This is similar to the SAP_PAPM schema of default plan.

Writing from SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model to External SAP HANA Cloud Schema

Using the Writer function, SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model can write back to your external SAP HANA Cloud schema. This will be needing additional grants other than select, depending on the Writer type you will be using.

For example, if the required privilege is not yet granted, you will get an error like the image below:

To avoid these kinds of errors, you may follow the procedure below.

  1. Login to your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your external schema credentials.
CONNECT DBMEMBER PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>; ‚Äã

       2. In order for Writer Type to perform Insert , using the credentials of your own external schema , execute the SQL statement below :

GRANT INSERT ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO <SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>>;‚Äã

       3. In order for Writer Type to perform Delete and Insert , using the credentials of your own external schema , execute the SQL statement below

GRANT INSERT ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO <SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>>;
GRANT DELETE ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO <SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID>>;

SAP_PAPM_SM_<TenantID> refers to schema where the generated artifacts of Standard Model are located. This is similar to the SAP_PAPM schema of default plan.

Universal Model

Following the procedures added in the help portal Manage Connections, you may start performing Inbound and Outbound scenarios for Universal Model given by the steps below.

Inbound Scenarios

Accessing artifacts from External SAP HANA Cloud schema

Your existing external SAP HANA Cloud schema can be used as the Target HANA Schema on your connection in your Universal Model.

Still using the DBMEMBER used from Standard Model scenarios, initially, if you are going to create a Connection in Manage Connection screen, your schema is not yet visible to be used as expected.

This is because we need to grant a privilege to the technical schema of SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model.

  1. With this, you need to login on your Standalone HCDB using your external user credentials using the syntax below:
CONNECT DBMEMBER PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      2. Once logged in, perform the SQL Statement syntax below:

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO "SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>::external_privileges_role" WITH GRANT OPTION;‚Äã

This SQL statement above is performed for your external schema to appear in the list of schema on the creation of HANA Schema connection.

However, on the saving of creation of connection, you will encounter and error like the image below:

With this, you will be needing to perform another grant of privilege to the technical schema of Universal Model which you can refer to the syntax below:

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA DBMEMBER TO "SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>#OO" WITH GRANT OPTION;

Once the granting of privileges is done, you may now perform the mapping on your available Model from Target HANA Schema, Activate the Environment and then go to Show data screen to validate the table.

Writing to SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model artifacts (Z-tables) from External SAP HANA Cloud schema

SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model supports Data lifecycle Management, therefore, authorized external SAP HANA Cloud schema can perform writing to existing artifacts(Z-tables).

On the subscription of SAP PAPM Cloud, only Database Administrator has the capability to grant the role collection external_access_role. This role collection consists of select, insert, update and delete privileges.

Adding ‚Äú#‚Äù on the role collection external_access_role# will add a Grant option that will let the user give the same privileges to other users.

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your Database Admin user.
CONNECT DBADMIN PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      2. Once logged in as the DBADMIN, you may now perform the SQL Statement below to grant your _RT user for external access role.

GRANT "SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>"."external_access_role#" TO SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>::external_privileges_role WITH ADMIN OPTION ‚Äã

Note:
external_access_role# role gives read access to the whole ${PAPM_UM} schema and write access to Z tables (Z_* tables) located within the Universal Model schema.

After the run of SQL Statement syntax above, SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>_<UniqueID>_RT schema will have a Grant option that means it can provide the same role to other user.

      3. Login again on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<XXXXX>_<YYYYY>_RT user.

CONNECT SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>_<UniqueID>_RT PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      4. As SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<XXXXX>_<YYYYY>_RT user, grant back DBADMIN the power to give access to your SAP_PAPM_UM_<XXXXX> by following the SQL statement below.

GRANT "SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>"."external_access_role#" TO DBADMIN WITH ADMIN OPTION‚Äã

Note:
external_access_role# role gives read access to the whole ${PAPM_UM} schema and write access to Z tables (Z_* tables) located within the Universal Model schema.

Since SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<TenantID>_<UniqueID>_RT schema has the Grant option granted from Step 2, we can Grant back the role SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>"."external_access_role#"  to Database Administrator so that it will be able to Grant the role collection to other users.

     5. Login again on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your DBADMIN user.

CONNECT DBADMIN PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

     6. As DBADMIN user, perform the granting of privileges on a specific artifact from SAP PAPM UM by following the SQL Statement below:

GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>.<Z_METABLE> TO <ExternalUser>;‚Äã

Since Database Administrator has now external_access_role#. It can now grant privileges to other users to specific artifacts based on its use cases.
You may also perform a Revoke as Database Administrator that will remove the privileges to your _RT user so that only DBADMIN can manage the granting of privileges to SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID> objects.

REVOKE

"SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>"."external_access_role#" FROM "SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_<XXXXX>_<YYYYY>_RT";


For more information, see REVOKE Statement (Access Control).

Outbound Scenarios

Expose Z table entries to external SAP HANA Cloud schema

Follow the procedure outlined below to allow access to your SAP PAPM UM artifacts, such as z-tables and views, from your external SAP HANA Cloud schema:

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_XXXXX_YYYYY_RT as this user refers to SAP_PAPM_ADMIN like schema which is default database user available after subscription.
    <XXXXX> is equal to Tenant ID of the subaccount minus the hyphen.
    <YYYYY> is a random GUID unique for the tenant.

    This SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_TenantID_UniqueID info can be seen from Hamburger Menu > Administration > Setings. Once you have the credentials, you can follow the SQL Statement syntax below:
CONNECT <SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_TenandID_UniqueID_RT PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;

       2. Once logged in as the SAP_PAPM_SM_HDI_XXXXX_YYYYY_RT user, you may now perform the below SQL Statement syntax to grant the privilege to available artifacts to external schema:

GRANT SELECT ON SCHEMA ‚ÄúSAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>‚Äù TO ‚Äú<ExternalUser>;‚Äã

This SQL Statement above will allow the external schema to perform a read on z-tables available in SAP PAPM Cloud UM

SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID> refers to schema where the generated artifacts of Universal Model are located. This is similar to the SAP_PAPM_UM schema of default plan.

Writing from SAP PAPM Cloud Universal Model to External SAP HANA Cloud Schema

Follow the procedure outlined below to enable the SAP PAPM Universal Model to perform write operations, such as inserting or deleting data in the tables of your external schema using the Writer Function:

Procedure:

  1. Login on your SAP HANA Cloud Database using your external schema credentials.
CONNECT <ExternaUser> PASSWORD <‚ÄùPassword‚Äù>;‚Äã

      2. In order for Writer Type to perform Insert, using the credentials of your own external schema , execute the SQL statement below :

GRANT INSERT ON SCHEMA <ExternalUser> TO SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>#OO;‚Äã

      3. In order for Writer Type to perform Delete and Insert, using the credentials of your own external schema , execute the SQL statement below

GRANT DELETE, INSERT ON SCHEMA <ExternalUser> TO SAP_PAPM_UM_<TenantID>#OO;‚Äã

We are done! I hope all scenarios above will be useful for Administration of your BYOD plan using the Standalone SAP HANA Cloud.

You may also refer to our official documentation on:

  • Standard Model Administration of BYOD Plan on Standalone HANA Cloud Database
  • Universal Model Administration of BYOD Plan on Standalone HANA Cloud Database

Stay tune for the part 2 of this blog post where we will discuss how we can Administer BYOD plan of SAP PAPM Cloud .

Bye for now!

entry.title: Re: Handling units with MTO: Sales order to be filled aut...
entry.content:
In REM, the system typically works with run schedule quantities and production versions, not directly with sales orders. Even though you‚Äôve linked the HU to the sales order during packing (via MFP1), MFHU doesn‚Äôt automatically inherit that reference during backflush. The MFHU transaction is designed to backflush based on HU and material, not necessarily the sales order context unless explicitly provided.

So what you can try is to explore implicit enhancements in the MFHU program (SAPLVHURM) to auto-populate the sales order field. Use a lookup based on HU number to retrieve the linked sales order and inject it into the backflush screen.

entry.title: Re: Project purchasing with stock management
entry.content:
Procurement for Stock (J45) is the preferred approach if you want to manage inventory and later consume it for project purposes because,

  1. Stock materials are procured and stored in inventory
  2. No account assignment is needed at the time of purchase.
  3. You can later issue the stock to a WBS element or project using a goods issue transaction.
  4. This allows valuation and quantity tracking in the material master and supports project cost control via stock consumption.

Recommended Best Practice is to use valuated project stock if you're working with projects with revenue. Materials are reserved and consumed only by the assigned project/WBS element

Procurement for Direct Consumption (BNX) is suitable when materials are not stored but consumed immediately upon receipt. Requires account assignment in the purchase order (e.g., cost center, WBS element). No inventory is created; the value is directly expensed. Works well for services, non-stock items, or one-time consumables. Most importantly, the limitations here is You lose visibility into stock levels and cannot reuse materials across projects.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Download License file for SAP NetWeaver AS...
entry.content:
Hi everyone, I have tried this, and it worked for me. There may be an issue with some locations. To resolve this, you need to do the following:

  1. Delete your cache.
  2. Try a different browser.
  3. If that fails, please email SCNContent [at]sap[dot]com, with:
    • URL of download
    • User ID
    • User IP
    • Date, Time, Time zone, and location (country) of attempted downloads
    • screenshot of the error

Note: URL must be in the form: https://www.sap.com/registration/trial.<GUID1>.html?id=<guid2>&external-site=<GUID3>

Also: You can send a mail to me as well, if you like, but you need to send it to the address above.

Sorry for the inconvenience.

Best wishes,
Julie Plummer.

entry.title: Re: Backflush Not Working in SAP Public Cloud + DM Integr...
entry.content:
Hi @Suresh-Eswaran ,

Please make sure you have the respective role (Production_Operator) assigned and the collaboration link COLLABORATION_QUANTITY_CONFIRMATION_DI is mapped to the directive PRODORD_QUANTITY_CONFIRMATION in the Manage Collaboration Links app in SAP Digital Manufacturing (SAP DM).

Also note that the backflush indicator is active for all the required BOM components in routing and the backflush indicator is passing on to the Production order in Public Cloud as well as in SAP DM (Manage Order app in SAP DM > check the tab Planned BOM, column Backflush is populated as 'Yes')

If all the setup and data maintained correctly, while posting qunatity confirmation via Order PoD for the respective operation (to which the backflush components assigned), components gets backflushed in SAP S/4HANA public cloud system. It can be verified by reviewing the documented goods movement for 261 in tcode CO03 of public cloud system.

Hope this helps.

Thanks and Regards,

Prabha A

entry.title: Binding a SAC Custom Widget to Multiple Models Simultaneously
entry.content:
Is it possible to connect a custom widget to more than one model at the same time? I'm developing a custom widget that compares data across models, and it would be highly beneficial to retrieve data directly from these models. Currently, I've implemented a workaround by passing data from hidden tables, each connected to a separate model.

According to the announcement post from 2022:

The keys of the dataBindings property represent the arbitrary name of the dataBinding, and contains a "feeds" property which is an array of objects that define a "feed". Currently this is limited to defining one dataBinding object. Defining multiples will not yield any error but only the first one will be used.

As far as I can tell, this limitation still applies. Are there any plans to support multiple dataBindings in the future?

Cheers,
≈Åukasz
